headshotImage.caption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Quinton de Kock c Mendis b Senanayake 128 (127b 12x4 3x6 162m) SR: 100.78

dismissalComment.html: doesn't matter. He's gone anyway. QdK attempts the same shot he played earlier in the over. It's a fullish ball, but Senanayake beats him in the flight and though the batsman gets a good chunk of the ball, he's hitting against the breeze. He hits that into the arms of Mendis at long off. End of a fine innings from a very promising player.

headshotImage.caption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Ashan Priyanjan player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ashan Priyanjan player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: AB de Villiers c Priyanjan b Mendis 108 (71b 11x4 4x6 101m) SR: 152.11

dismissalComment.html: he's gone. Finally, but the damage has been done. AB gets a googly and he tries to slam that over wide long on, but ends up mishitting it towards the cover sweeper. Priyanjan has had a poor day in the field, but he does well to keep his eyes on this one, as the wind carries it. A brilliant innings comes to an end.

oh dear! Amla's not happy with himself here. He's out, just as he looked certain to make his third 50-plus score of the series. He was down the track, but Herath - that wily operator - beat him in the air for what seems like the 91st time today. Amla doesn't get to the pitch, and the shot that he tried to hit over the covers ends up going down long off's throat. Why do Sri Lanka refuse to play Herath regularly in ODIs? I'll never know.

headshotImage.caption: Jacques Kallis player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Jacques Kallis player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: gone! That's out, surely. Rangana Herath slides this one with the arm, and hits Kallis low on the front pad around off stump. He did get bat on it as well, but it was after the ball hit pad. Kallis has asked for a review, but it's not looking good. It looks like the tracking software is not working, perhaps because of the wind at the venue. Anyway, despite the lack of a proper review, the umpire upholds his decision. There wasn't much doubt about that one anyway. Beautiful bowling by Herath. Kallis' woes continue.

headshotImage.caption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: he's gone. Finally, but the damage has been done. AB gets a googly and he tries to slam that over wide long on, but ends up mishitting it towards the cover sweeper. Priyanjan has had a poor day in the field, but he does well to keep his eyes on this one, as the wind carries it. A brilliant innings comes to an end.

erm, what was that? A friendly full toss, and JP was way too early into the shot. This is chipped back at Mendis who swallows it with ease. Maybe the wind got a hold of this one and changed the direction. Either way, it's two in two for Sri Lanka.

headshotImage.caption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023
headshotImage.longCaption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023

headshotImage.caption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023
headshotImage.longCaption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023

headshotImage.caption: Ryan McLaren player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ryan McLaren player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Angelo Mathews c Morkel b McLaren 58 (81b 5x4 1x6 127m) SR: 71.6

dismissalComment.html: super catch, and that may be the game for the hosts! Again the bouncer gets rid of a batsman. Mathews doesn't control the hook shot, and the tallest man on the park is at short fine leg. Morkel sticks his giant paws up and the ball sticks to his left palm like it's a glue trap. South Africa on the brink of making ODI history here. AB plants a big kiss on Morkel's cheek. He knows what that wicket means, and he's not afraid to show it.

headshotImage.caption: Kusal Perera player page headshot cutout 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kusal Perera player page headshot cutout 2021

headshotImage.caption: Kusal Perera player page headshot cutout 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kusal Perera player page headshot cutout 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Kusal Perera c de Villiers b Parnell 37 (25b 4x4 2x6 32m) SR: 148

dismissalComment.html: a slower ball does the trick for Kusal. So often Kusal gets off to a flyer and gives it away. He's done a decent job here though. This is full outside off stump, Kusal tries to bang that over mid off, but he mistimes it and offers a simple catch to the man there instead. AB, the fielder, holds up a clenched fist.

headshotImage.caption: Ryan McLaren player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ryan McLaren player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: gone!  Stangled down the leg side. Sanga goes now and that's a huge blow for this chase. That was an awful ball, waist height about six inches outside leg. Sanga tries to help it on its way, but gets an under edge. Two wickets in two overs now. McLaren had a sliver of his boot behind the white line, so it's not a no-ball, thought the umpires check it.

headshotImage.caption: Ashan Priyanjan player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ashan Priyanjan player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: gone! Priyanjan always looked uncomfortable against the slower bouncer. This one bounces less than he expected. He's trying to swat it away to the off side but it takes a thin edge through to the keeper. Mathews is now stuck with the tail and SL are still over 100 runs away.

headshotImage.caption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023
headshotImage.longCaption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023

dismissalComment.html: super catch, and that may be the game for the hosts! Again the bouncer gets rid of a batsman. Mathews doesn't control the hook shot, and the tallest man on the park is at short fine leg. Morkel sticks his giant paws up and the ball sticks to his left palm like it's a glue trap. South Africa on the brink of making ODI history here. AB plants a big kiss on Morkel's cheek. He knows what that wicket means, and he's not afraid to show it.

what a ball! He's been turning a few quite sharply all innings, but this time he gets a wicket for it. He's coming in from wide of the crease, flighting it in to pitch at around off stump. The ball spins sharply, beats Thiri's blade, which is miles away, and crashes into off. Sri Lanka's woes continue. Huge job ahead.
Malinga is down the track trying to smash it over the bowler's head, but mistimes it horribly and sends up a lob. Duminy backtracks from the crease and gets under it. Makes no mistake.

headshotImage.caption: Kusal Perera player page headshot cutout 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kusal Perera player page headshot cutout 2021

headshotImage.caption: Kusal Perera player page headshot cutout 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kusal Perera player page headshot cutout 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Kusal Perera c de Villiers b Parnell 37 (25b 4x4 2x6 32m) SR: 148

dismissalComment.html: a slower ball does the trick for Kusal. So often Kusal gets off to a flyer and gives it away. He's done a decent job here though. This is full outside off stump, Kusal tries to bang that over mid off, but he mistimes it and offers a simple catch to the man there instead. AB, the fielder, holds up a clenched fist.

dismissalText.commentary: Tillakaratne Dilshan run out (de Villiers/de Kock) 30 (24b 5x4 0x6 65m) SR: 125

dismissalComment.html: mayhem! SA get the breakthrough via a run out where both batsmen end up at the same end. Dilshan is not happy with Sanga. He whips it straight to shortish-midwicket and takes off, Sanga moves towards him initially, but then turns back. Not sure who made which call. Sanga gets back to the non-striker's crease first and Dilshan has to walk off. QdK takes the bails off easy.

headshotImage.caption: Ryan McLaren player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ryan McLaren player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Kumar Sangakkara c de Kock b McLaren 36 (23b 6x4 0x6 41m) SR: 156.52

dismissalComment.html: gone!  Stangled down the leg side. Sanga goes now and that's a huge blow for this chase. That was an awful ball, waist height about six inches outside leg. Sanga tries to help it on its way, but gets an under edge. Two wickets in two overs now. McLaren had a sliver of his boot behind the white line, so it's not a no-ball, thought the umpires check it.

dismissalText.commentary: Mahela Jayawardene c Steyn b Imran Tahir 2 (8b 0x4 0x6 12m) SR: 25

dismissalComment.html: gone! Sri Lanka are falling apart here. Mahela's gone now, playing a top-edged sweep that carried all the way to the man at fine leg, thanks to some help from the wind. He didn't want to sweep it that hard, but any shot to that side of the ground is going to carry further. Huge pressure on this inexperienced middle order now. They need a big stand. Imran Tahir is ecstatic. But isn't he always?

dismissalText.commentary: Lahiru Thirimanne b Duminy 22 (37b 1x4 0x6 46m) SR: 59.45

dismissalComment.html: what a ball! He's been turning a few quite sharply all innings, but this time he gets a wicket for it. He's coming in from wide of the crease, flighting it in to pitch at around off stump. The ball spins sharply, beats Thiri's blade, which is miles away, and crashes into off. Sri Lanka's woes continue. Huge job ahead.

dismissalText.commentary: Angelo Mathews c Morkel b McLaren 58 (81b 5x4 1x6 127m) SR: 71.6

dismissalComment.html: super catch, and that may be the game for the hosts! Again the bouncer gets rid of a batsman. Mathews doesn't control the hook shot, and the tallest man on the park is at short fine leg. Morkel sticks his giant paws up and the ball sticks to his left palm like it's a glue trap. South Africa on the brink of making ODI history here. AB plants a big kiss on Morkel's cheek. He knows what that wicket means, and he's not afraid to show it.

dismissalText.commentary: Rangana Herath c de Kock b Morkel 1 (4b 0x4 0x6 8m) SR: 25

dismissalComment.html: short and a little wide, Herath tries to heave it away to the leg side, but only gets a top edge. It goes high over the keeper, but QdK runs back to complete a pretty comfortable catch.

headshotImage.caption: Jacques Kallis player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Jacques Kallis player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Sachithra Senanayake c Kallis b Morkel 13 (16b 2x4 0x6 22m) SR: 81.25

dismissalComment.html: two in two for Morkel. That's a full toss that Senanayake tries to loft over the off side, but he's hitting into the wind and has played the shot too early in any case. Jacques Kallis gets under it at the edge of the circle and pouches it no problem. SA one wicket away from their first ODI series win in the country.

dismissalText.commentary: Lasith Malinga c & b Duminy 0 (3b 0x4 0x6 4m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: Malinga is down the track trying to smash it over the bowler's head, but mistimes it horribly and sends up a lob. Duminy backtracks from the crease and gets under it. Makes no mistake.

headshotImage.caption: Ryan McLaren player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ryan McLaren player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Lasith Malinga c & b Duminy 0 (3b 0x4 0x6 4m) SR: 0

commentTextItems.html: Malinga is down the track trying to smash it over the bowler's head, but mistimes it horribly and sends up a lob. Duminy backtracks from the crease and gets under it. Makes no mistake.

commentPostTextItems.html: Matches at Galle are always high value. Will leave you with this from Apoorv: "I think Ranjit summed up AB perfectly,"He is the fusion of old and the modern way of playing cricket". Perfect definition for him"
Well, that's it from us. Join us again for the Test, which starts Wednesday, but in the meantime switch over to the England match, where Joe Root and Anderson are making history of their own.

De Villiers is up again:"It's not a World Cup, but for us it's a huge step in the right direction. Angelo and his boys have been playing a lot of good cricket. I'm exceptionally proud of the boys, there's no one or two guys that stand out. I'm just proud of the team." If you hadn't guessed it, AB is the man of the match as well.

Hashim Amla is the player of the series, having crossed 100 twice and made 48 today. Amla:"I'm grateful to get some runs. I think this wicket is the flattest wicket I've ever played on. We'll take some confidence from this going forward, but tomorrow the Test preparations start. Everyone came here with the desire to make history. We had the baggage of that last series. AB's innings today was special to take us to a big total. On this type of wicket we needed a big total to defend.

De Villiers: "Very happy with the boys. It's our first series win here, so we'll celebrate tonight. I thought we slipped up a little early but we made it up in the end. Sri Lanka bowled well in that Powerplay, but later on I was seeing the ball really well."

Presentation now. Mathews: "We don't deserve to win the way we played today. We were flat on the field, let go of a few catches and didn't play well. It was a depressing performance. Losing to a foreign team is not the end of the world. I'm happy with my own batting, but it doesn't mean anything, since we lost."

Interestingly, Tahir and Herath were the bowlers of the day. They will face off again at Galle, which is sure to take loads of spin. That's a good contest to watch as the teams move to red-ball cricket.

De Villiers was the difference between the sides in this match. What an innings his hundred was. SL looked good in the Powerplay, but then Sanga and Dilshan fell in quick succession, and Mahela's mediocre ODI run continued. Mathews and Priyanjan were shackled by good bowling and excellent fielding, while the wind died down a bit to make things easier for SA.
Imran Tahir, Hashim Amla, AB de Villiers and Ryan McLaren have been fantastic in this series. Sri Lanka were hot and cold and fell apart in the field when Malinga had a few off days.

Huge wide smiles for South Africa. AB de Villiers in particular. They were not fancied before this series, but they have been focused and intense in game one and game three. The victors get into an ecstatic huddle before they shake hands. It means a lot to them after the 4-1 drubbing last year.

commentTextItems.html: floated up, straightening on middle, defended
wide of off stump, but he turns it back in just enough for it to be legal

commentPreTextItems.html: Malinga in to face the hat-trick ball.

commentTextItems.html: full toss on off stump, Mendis just defends it

full on off stump, SS is too early into the shot, but he gets an inside edge and takes a single to the leg side
another short ball, quicker this time and closer in to the stumps. The batsman tries to repeat the dose and misses
short and somewhat wide. SS gets nicely under it and hits it over backward point for four
floated up on off stump, defended by Herath

headshotImage.caption: Ryan McLaren player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ryan McLaren player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: Herath tries the reverse sweep first up, probably picked the googly, Doesn't connect though
floated in on off stump, driven down to long off
floated up and turning away sharply, the batsman doesn't even play at that
another quick leggie, SS is down the pitch and gets pad in the way
fast leggie, SS tries to chop it, but misses
yorker, dug out toward long on

headshotImage.longCaption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023

headshotImage.caption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: he's gone. Finally, but the damage has been done. AB gets a googly and he tries to slam that over wide long on, but ends up mishitting it towards the cover sweeper. Priyanjan has had a poor day in the field, but he does well to keep his eyes on this one, as the wind carries it. A brilliant innings comes to an end.

erm, what was that? A friendly full toss, and JP was way too early into the shot. This is chipped back at Mendis who swallows it with ease. Maybe the wind got a hold of this one and changed the direction. Either way, it's two in two for Sri Lanka.

oh dear! Amla's not happy with himself here. He's out, just as he looked certain to make his third 50-plus score of the series. He was down the track, but Herath - that wily operator - beat him in the air for what seems like the 91st time today. Amla doesn't get to the pitch, and the shot that he tried to hit over the covers ends up going down long off's throat. Why do Sri Lanka refuse to play Herath regularly in ODIs? I'll never know.

headshotImage.caption: Jacques Kallis player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Jacques Kallis player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: gone! That's out, surely. Rangana Herath slides this one with the arm, and hits Kallis low on the front pad around off stump. He did get bat on it as well, but it was after the ball hit pad. Kallis has asked for a review, but it's not looking good. It looks like the tracking software is not working, perhaps because of the wind at the venue. Anyway, despite the lack of a proper review, the umpire upholds his decision. There wasn't much doubt about that one anyway. Beautiful bowling by Herath. Kallis' woes continue.

headshotImage.caption: Jacques Kallis player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Jacques Kallis player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Ryan McLaren player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ryan McLaren player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Hashim Amla c Senanayake b Herath 48 (61b 4x4 0x6 83m) SR: 78.68

dismissalComment.html: oh dear! Amla's not happy with himself here. He's out, just as he looked certain to make his third 50-plus score of the series. He was down the track, but Herath - that wily operator - beat him in the air for what seems like the 91st time today. Amla doesn't get to the pitch, and the shot that he tried to hit over the covers ends up going down long off's throat. Why do Sri Lanka refuse to play Herath regularly in ODIs? I'll never know.

headshotImage.caption: Jacques Kallis player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Jacques Kallis player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Jacques Kallis player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Jacques Kallis player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Jacques Kallis lbw b Herath 4 (10b 0x4 0x6 17m) SR: 40

dismissalComment.html: gone! That's out, surely. Rangana Herath slides this one with the arm, and hits Kallis low on the front pad around off stump. He did get bat on it as well, but it was after the ball hit pad. Kallis has asked for a review, but it's not looking good. It looks like the tracking software is not working, perhaps because of the wind at the venue. Anyway, despite the lack of a proper review, the umpire upholds his decision. There wasn't much doubt about that one anyway. Beautiful bowling by Herath. Kallis' woes continue.

headshotImage.caption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Quinton de Kock c Mendis b Senanayake 128 (127b 12x4 3x6 162m) SR: 100.78

dismissalComment.html: doesn't matter. He's gone anyway. QdK attempts the same shot he played earlier in the over. It's a fullish ball, but Senanayake beats him in the flight and though the batsman gets a good chunk of the ball, he's hitting against the breeze. He hits that into the arms of Mendis at long off. End of a fine innings from a very promising player.

headshotImage.caption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Ashan Priyanjan player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ashan Priyanjan player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: AB de Villiers c Priyanjan b Mendis 108 (71b 11x4 4x6 101m) SR: 152.11

dismissalComment.html: he's gone. Finally, but the damage has been done. AB gets a googly and he tries to slam that over wide long on, but ends up mishitting it towards the cover sweeper. Priyanjan has had a poor day in the field, but he does well to keep his eyes on this one, as the wind carries it. A brilliant innings comes to an end.

headshotImage.caption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Jean-Paul Duminy c & b Mendis 29 (24b 2x4 1x6 42m) SR: 120.83

dismissalComment.html: erm, what was that? A friendly full toss, and JP was way too early into the shot. This is chipped back at Mendis who swallows it with ease. Maybe the wind got a hold of this one and changed the direction. Either way, it's two in two for Sri Lanka.

headshotImage.caption: Kusal Perera player page headshot cutout 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kusal Perera player page headshot cutout 2021

headshotImage.caption: Kusal Perera player page headshot cutout 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kusal Perera player page headshot cutout 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Kusal Perera c de Villiers b Parnell 37 (25b 4x4 2x6 32m) SR: 148

dismissalComment.html: a slower ball does the trick for Kusal. So often Kusal gets off to a flyer and gives it away. He's done a decent job here though. This is full outside off stump, Kusal tries to bang that over mid off, but he mistimes it and offers a simple catch to the man there instead. AB, the fielder, holds up a clenched fist.

dismissalText.commentary: Tillakaratne Dilshan run out (de Villiers/de Kock) 30 (24b 5x4 0x6 65m) SR: 125

dismissalComment.html: mayhem! SA get the breakthrough via a run out where both batsmen end up at the same end. Dilshan is not happy with Sanga. He whips it straight to shortish-midwicket and takes off, Sanga moves towards him initially, but then turns back. Not sure who made which call. Sanga gets back to the non-striker's crease first and Dilshan has to walk off. QdK takes the bails off easy.

headshotImage.caption: Ryan McLaren player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ryan McLaren player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Kumar Sangakkara c de Kock b McLaren 36 (23b 6x4 0x6 41m) SR: 156.52

dismissalComment.html: gone!  Stangled down the leg side. Sanga goes now and that's a huge blow for this chase. That was an awful ball, waist height about six inches outside leg. Sanga tries to help it on its way, but gets an under edge. Two wickets in two overs now. McLaren had a sliver of his boot behind the white line, so it's not a no-ball, thought the umpires check it.

dismissalText.commentary: Mahela Jayawardene c Steyn b Imran Tahir 2 (8b 0x4 0x6 12m) SR: 25

dismissalComment.html: gone! Sri Lanka are falling apart here. Mahela's gone now, playing a top-edged sweep that carried all the way to the man at fine leg, thanks to some help from the wind. He didn't want to sweep it that hard, but any shot to that side of the ground is going to carry further. Huge pressure on this inexperienced middle order now. They need a big stand. Imran Tahir is ecstatic. But isn't he always?

dismissalText.commentary: Lahiru Thirimanne b Duminy 22 (37b 1x4 0x6 46m) SR: 59.45

dismissalComment.html: what a ball! He's been turning a few quite sharply all innings, but this time he gets a wicket for it. He's coming in from wide of the crease, flighting it in to pitch at around off stump. The ball spins sharply, beats Thiri's blade, which is miles away, and crashes into off. Sri Lanka's woes continue. Huge job ahead.

headshotImage.caption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023
headshotImage.longCaption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023

headshotImage.caption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023
headshotImage.longCaption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023

headshotImage.caption: Ryan McLaren player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ryan McLaren player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Angelo Mathews c Morkel b McLaren 58 (81b 5x4 1x6 127m) SR: 71.6

dismissalComment.html: super catch, and that may be the game for the hosts! Again the bouncer gets rid of a batsman. Mathews doesn't control the hook shot, and the tallest man on the park is at short fine leg. Morkel sticks his giant paws up and the ball sticks to his left palm like it's a glue trap. South Africa on the brink of making ODI history here. AB plants a big kiss on Morkel's cheek. He knows what that wicket means, and he's not afraid to show it.

headshotImage.caption: Ashan Priyanjan player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ashan Priyanjan player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Ashan Priyanjan player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ashan Priyanjan player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Ryan McLaren player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ryan McLaren player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Ashan Priyanjan c de Kock b McLaren 30 (46b 3x4 0x6 72m) SR: 65.21

dismissalComment.html: gone! Priyanjan always looked uncomfortable against the slower bouncer. This one bounces less than he expected. He's trying to swat it away to the off side but it takes a thin edge through to the keeper. Mathews is now stuck with the tail and SL are still over 100 runs away.

headshotImage.caption: Jacques Kallis player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Jacques Kallis player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Sachithra Senanayake c Kallis b Morkel 13 (16b 2x4 0x6 22m) SR: 81.25

dismissalComment.html: two in two for Morkel. That's a full toss that Senanayake tries to loft over the off side, but he's hitting into the wind and has played the shot too early in any case. Jacques Kallis gets under it at the edge of the circle and pouches it no problem. SA one wicket away from their first ODI series win in the country.

dismissalText.commentary: Rangana Herath c de Kock b Morkel 1 (4b 0x4 0x6 8m) SR: 25

dismissalComment.html: short and a little wide, Herath tries to heave it away to the leg side, but only gets a top edge. It goes high over the keeper, but QdK runs back to complete a pretty comfortable catch.

headshotImage.caption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Ajantha Mendis not out 0 (1b 0x4 0x6 5m) SR: 0
Lasith Malinga c & b Duminy 0 (3b 0x4 0x6 4m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: Malinga is down the track trying to smash it over the bowler's head, but mistimes it horribly and sends up a lob. Duminy backtracks from the crease and gets under it. Makes no mistake.

Q de Kock: 50 off 46 balls (8 x 4, 1 x 6)
South Africa: 100 runs in 17.5 overs (107 balls), Extras 2

Drinks: South Africa - 104/0 in 19.0 overs (HM Amla 39, Q de Kock 63)

Over 25.3: Review by South Africa (Batting), Umpire - SJ Davis, Batsman - JH Kallis (Struck down)
South Africa: 150 runs in 29.2 overs (176 balls), Extras 3
3rd Wicket: 50 runs in 51 balls (Q de Kock 21, AB de Villiers 31, Ex 0)
Q de Kock: 100 off 108 balls (10 x 4, 1 x 6)
South Africa: 200 runs in 35.5 overs (215 balls), Extras 3
Drinks: South Africa - 212/2 in 37.0 overs (Q de Kock 108, AB de Villiers 48)
AB de Villiers: 50 off 41 balls (5 x 4, 1 x 6)
3rd Wicket: 100 runs in 83 balls (Q de Kock 42, AB de Villiers 58, Ex 1)
South Africa: 250 runs in 40.6 overs (246 balls), Extras 4
South Africa: 300 runs in 46.2 overs (278 balls), Extras 5
4th Wicket: 50 runs in 34 balls (AB de Villiers 35, JP Duminy 16, Ex 1)
AB de Villiers: 100 off 66 balls (11 x 4, 3 x 6)
Innings Break: South Africa - 339/5 in 50.0 overs (DA Miller 4, R McLaren 2)
Sri Lanka innings
Powerplay 1: Overs 0.1 - 10.0 (Mandatory - 99 runs, 1 wicket)
Sri Lanka: 50 runs in 4.6 overs (30 balls), Extras 5
1st Wicket: 50 runs in 30 balls (MDKJ Perera 37, TM Dilshan 10, Ex 5)
Sri Lanka: 100 runs in 10.1 overs (61 balls), Extras 7
2nd Wicket: 50 runs in 33 balls (TM Dilshan 15, KC Sangakkara 32, Ex 3)
Drinks: Sri Lanka - 113/3 in 13.0 overs (DPMD Jayawardene 2)
Over 20.4: Review by Sri Lanka (Batting), Umpire - REJ Martinesz, Batsman - HDRL Thirimanne (Upheld)
Sri Lanka: 150 runs in 23.4 overs (142 balls), Extras 19

Drinks: Sri Lanka - 169/5 in 28.0 overs (AD Mathews 15, SMA Priyanjan 6)

stories.title: Sri Lanka v South Africa, 2014
stories.subTitle: 3rd ODI, Hambantota
stories.seoTitle: Wisden Almanack review: Sri Lanka v South Africa, 2014
stories.summary: Wisden's review of the third ODI, Sri Lanka v South Africa, 2014

stories.title: Mathews bemoans 'awful cricket'
stories.subTitle: Sri Lanka v South Africa, 3rd ODI, Hambantota
stories.summary: Sri Lanka captain Angelo Mathews has slammed his team for playing "awful cricket" during their 82-run defeat to South Africa in the third ODI

image.caption: Angelo Mathews had to arrest a middle-order wobble
image.longCaption: Angelo Mathews had to arrest a middle-order wobble, Sri Lanka v South Africa, 3rd ODI, Hambantota, July 12, 2014

stories.title: South Africa beat the Sri Lankan bogey
stories.subTitle: Sri Lanka v South Africa, 3rd ODI, Hambantota
stories.seoTitle: South Africa beat the Sri Lankan bogey
stories.summary: South Africa's maiden ODI series win in Sri Lanka showcased the lessons they had learned from a chastening 1-4 drubbing the last time they visited - An improved top-order and a better spin attack

image.caption: Ryan McLaren roars after dismissing Kumar Sangakkara
image.longCaption: Ryan McLaren roars after dismissing Kumar Sangakkara, Sri Lanka v South Africa, 3rd ODI, Hambantota, July 12, 2014

stories.title: 'A statement of what we can achieve' - de Villiers
stories.subTitle: Sri Lanka v South Africa, 3rd ODI, Hambantota
stories.seoTitle: 'A statement of what we can achieve' - AB de Villiers
stories.summary: AB de Villiers said the series victory in Sri Lanka was "a statement of what we can achieve as a team"

image.caption: South Africa celebrate their series win
image.longCaption: South Africa celebrate their series win, Sri Lanka v South Africa, 3rd ODI, Hambantota, July 12, 2014

stories.title: A series win set up by the batsmen
stories.subTitle: Sri Lanka v South Africa, ODI series
stories.seoTitle: A series win set up by the batsmen
stories.summary: In 16 previous ODIs against Sri Lanka in Sri Lanka, there'd been only one century for South Africa; in three matches in this series, there were four

image.caption: Hashim Amla drives hits off the back foot
image.longCaption: Hashim Amla drives hits off the back foot, Sri Lanka v South Africa, 1st ODI, Colombo, July 6, 2014

stories.title: De Kock, De Villiers fashion historic win
stories.subTitle: Sri Lanka v South Africa, 3rd ODI, Hambantota
stories.seoTitle: De Kock, De Villiers fashion historic win
stories.summary: South Africa, driven by twin centuries from Quinton de Kock and AB de Villiers, secured their first ODI series win in Sri Lanka

image.caption: Quinton de Kock and Hashim Amla added 118 for the first wicket
image.longCaption: Quinton de Kock and Hashim Amla added 118 for the first wicket, Sri Lanka v South Africa, 3rd ODI, Hambantota, July 12, 2014

stories.title: Duminy keen to dispel spin demons
stories.subTitle: Sri Lanka v South Africa, 3rd ODI, Hambantota
stories.seoTitle: JP Duminy keen to dispel spin demons
stories.summary: After South Africa's collapse in the previous game, JP Duminy wants to use the final ODI to prove the team can handle spin

stories.title: South Africa beat the Sri Lankan bogey
stories.subTitle: Sri Lanka v South Africa, 3rd ODI, Hambantota
stories.seoTitle: South Africa beat the Sri Lankan bogey
stories.summary: South Africa's maiden ODI series win in Sri Lanka showcased the lessons they had learned from a chastening 1-4 drubbing the last time they visited - An improved top-order and a better spin attack

stories.title: A series win set up by the batsmen
stories.subTitle: Sri Lanka v South Africa, ODI series
stories.seoTitle: A series win set up by the batsmen
stories.summary: In 16 previous ODIs against Sri Lanka in Sri Lanka, there'd been only one century for South Africa; in three matches in this series, there were four
